action.action-desc: Mr. Crow (for himself and Mr. Bacon) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Small Business

form.official-title: To amend the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to increase the maximum loan amount for certain loans.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Small Business Energy Loan Enhancement Act.

section.header: Increase in certain maximum loan amounts

subsection.text: Section 502(2)(A) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 (15 U.S.C. 696(2)(A)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in clause (iv), by striking $5,500,000 and inserting $10,000,000; and
in clause (v), by striking $5,500,000 and inserting $10,000,000.

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter, the Administrator of the Small Business Administration shall submit to Congress a report that details, for the year covered by the report, the industries and geographic areas with respect to which the Administrator has made loans under clauses (iv) and (v) of section 502(2)(A) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 (15 U.S.C. 696(2)(A)), as amended by subsection (a).
